intro: Gerardia caddoensis, commonly known as Caddo gerardia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
